name: Anti-Intellectual Revolution ω
text1: For: Technologies with prerequisites require 1 additional prerequisite, matching any they already have. When a player would research a technology, they may gain 3 command tokens instead.
text2: Against: Players return 1 of their non-unit upgrade, non-faction technologies that has the most prerequisites to their technology deck.
mapText: Technologies require 1 additional prerequisite, matching any prerequisite they already have.

name: Arms Reduction ω
text1: For: Each player destroys half of their dreadnoughts and half of their cruisers, rounded down, and gains trade goods equal to half of the combined cost of those ships.
text2: Against: The player who cast the most votes "Against" researches a unit upgrade technology; the speaker breaks ties. At the start of the next strategy phase, exhaust each planet that has a technology specialty.

name: Classified Document Leaks ω
target: Elect Scored Secret Objective (When this agenda is revealed, if there are 1 or fewer scored secret objectives, discard this card and reveal another agenda from the top of the deck.)
text1: The elected secret objective becomes a public objective; place it near the other public objectives in the common play area.
mapText: The elected secret objective becomes a public objective; place it near the other public objectives in the common play area.

name: Colonial Redistribution ω
text1: Units on the elected planet must be removed from the game board and placed by their owner on a different planet they control. Then, the player who controls the elected planet chooses another player with the fewest victory points; that player places 2 infantry and 1 PDS from their reinforcements on that planet.

name: Committee Formation ω
text1: The elected player gains this card. Before players vote on an agenda, the owner of this card may discard this card to choose an outcome to be resolved, as if each player had cast 1 vote for that outcome.
mapText: Before players vote on an agenda, the owner of this card may discard this card to choose an outcome to be resolved, as if each player had cast 1 vote for that outcome.

name: Conventions of War ω
text1: For: Players cannot use Bombardment against units that are on planets that have a trait.
text2: Against: Each player who voted "Against" or abstained discards 1 random action card from their hand.
mapText: Players cannot use Bombardment against units that are on planets that have a trait.

name: Covert Legislation ω
target: When this agenda is revealed, the speaker draws the next card in the agenda deck but does not reveal it to the other players. Instead, the speaker reads the eligible outcomes aloud (for, against, elect player, etc.); the other players vote for these outcomes as if they were outcomes of this agenda, without knowing their effects. The speaker votes first on this agenda, and must cast at least 1 vote if able.

name: Economic Equality ω
text1: For: Each player returns all of their trade goods to the supply. Then, each player gains 4 trade goods.
text2: Against: Each player who cast 5 or more votes "Against" gains 1 trade good. Then, the player who cast the most votes "Against" gains 4 trade goods; the speaker breaks ties.

name: Enforced Travel Ban ω
text1: For: Alpha and beta wormholes have no effect during movement.
text2: Against: Each player destroys 1 of their PDS that is in or adjacent to a system that contains an alpha or beta wormhole.
mapText: Alpha and beta wormholes have no effect during movement.

name: Executive Sanctions ω
text1: For: Each player can have a maximum of 5 action cards in their hand.
text2: Against: Each player with the fewest victory points draws 2 action cards. Each other player discards 1 random action card.
mapText: Each player can have a maximum of 5 action cards in their hand.

name: Fleet Regulations ω
text1: For: Each player cannot have more than 4 tokens in their fleet pool.
text2: Against: The player that cast the most votes "Against" places 2 command tokens from their reinforcements in their fleet pool; the speaker breaks ties.
mapText: Each player cannot have more than 4 tokens in their fleet pool.

name: Homeland Defense Act ω
text1: For: For each planet they control in their home system, each player may place 1 PDS from their reinforcements on that planet.
text2: Against: Each player who cast 10 or more votes places 1 command token from their reinforcements in their strategy pool.

name: Ixthian Artifact ω
text1: For: The speaker rolls 1 die. If the result is 6-10, each player may research 2 technologies. If the result is 1-5, destroy all units on Mecatol Rex; then, each player with units in systems adjacent to Mecatol Rex destroys 3 of their units in each of those systems.
text2: Against: Attach this card to the Mecatol Rex planet card. The player who controls Mecatol Rex gains 1 victory point, and loses 1 victory point if they lose control of Mecatol Rex.

name: Judicial Abolishment ω
target: Elect Law (When this agenda is revealed, if there are 1 or fewer laws in play, discard this card and reveal another agenda from the top of the deck.)
text1: Discard the elected law from play. The player who cast the most votes for the elected law gains the speaker token; the speaker breaks ties.

name: Minister of Commerce ω
text1: The elected player gains this card. After the owner of this card resolves the primary or secondary ability of the "Trade" strategy card, they gain 4 trade goods. When the owner of this card ends their turn, they may discard this card to replenish their commodities or to convert their commodities to trade goods.
mapText: After the owner of this card resolves the primary or secondary ability of the "Trade" strategy card, they gain 4 trade goods. When the owner of this card ends their turn, they may discard this card to replenish their commodities or to convert their commodities to trade goods.

name: Minister of Exploration ω
text1: The elected player gains this card. After the owner of this card gains command tokens while resolving the primary or secondary ability of the "Leadership" strategy card, they explore a planet they control. Before the owner of this card draws a card from an exploration deck, they may discard this card to look at each card in the deck, choose 1 to place on top, and discard the rest.
mapText: After the owner of this card resolves the primary or secondary ability of the "Leadership" strategy card, they explore a planet they control. Before the owner of this card draws a card from an exploration deck, they may discard this card to look at each card in the deck, choose 1 to place on top, and discard the rest.

name: Minister of Industry ω
text1: The elected player gains this card. After the owner of this card resolves the primary or secondary ability of the "Construction" strategy card, they may use the Production ability of 1 of their space docks. When the owner of this card resolves 1 of their Production abilities, they may discard this card to resolve an additional 1 of their Production abilities.
mapText: After the owner of this card resolves the primary or secondary ability of the "Construction" strategy card, they may use the Production ability of 1 of their space docks. When the owner of this card resolves 1 of their Production abilities, they may discard this card to resolve an additional 1 of their Production abilities.

name: Minister of Peace ω
text1: The elected player gains this card. After the owner of this card resolves the primary or secondary ability of the "Diplomacy" strategy card, they ready 1 planet they control. After a player activates a system that contains a different player's units, the owner of this card may discard this card to end the active player's turn.
mapText: After the owner of this card resolves the primary or secondary ability of the "Diplomacy" strategy card, they ready 1 planet they control. After a player activates a system that contains a different player's units, the owner of this card may discard this card to end the active player's turn.

name: Minister of Policy ω
text1: The elected player gains this card. When the owner of this card resolves the primary or secondary ability of the "Politics" strategy card, they draw 2 additional action cards. When another player plays an action card, the owner of this card may discard this card to cancel that action card.
mapText: When the owner of this card resolves the primary or secondary ability of the "Politics" strategy card, they draw 2 additional action cards. When another player plays an action card, the owner of this card may discard this card to cancel that action card.

name: Minister of Sciences ω
text1: The elected player gains this card. When the owner of this card resolves the primary or secondary ability of the "Technology" strategy card, they do not need to spend resources to research technology. When the owner of this card ends their turn, they may discard this card to research 1 technology.
mapText: When the owner of this card resolves the primary or secondary ability of the "Technology" strategy card, they do not need to spend resources to research technology. When the owner of this card ends their turn, they may discard this card to research 1 technology.

name: Minister of War ω
text1: The elected player gains this card. After the owner of this card resolves the primary or secondary ability of the "Warfare" strategy card, they may move 1 of their ships to any system that contains their ships. The owner of this card may discard this card after performing an action to remove 1 of their command tokens from the game board and perform a tactical action.
mapText: After the owner of this card resolves the primary or secondary ability of the "Warfare" strategy card, they may move 1 of their ships to any system that contains their ships. The owner of this card may discard this card after performing an action to remove 1 of their command tokens from the game board and perform a tactical action.

name: Miscount Disclosed ω
target: Elect Law (When this agenda is revealed, if the speaker chooses to, or if there are no laws in play, discard this card and reveal another agenda from the top of the deck.)
text1: The speaker chooses 1 law in play or in the discard pile. Then, players vote on that law as if it were just revealed from the top of the deck.

name: New Constitution ω
text1: For: The player who cast the most votes "For" gains the speaker token; the speaker breaks ties. Then, discard all laws from play and reveal an agenda from the top of the agenda deck.
text2: Against: The speaker must give 1 promissory note from their hand to each other player who cast 5 or more votes "Against". During the next strategy phase, players may not choose the "Politics" strategy card if another choice is available.

name: Prophecy of Ixth ω
text1: The elected player gains this card. The owner of this card applies +1 to the result of their fighters' combat rolls. The owner of this card may produce 1 additional fighter for their cost; these additional units do not count against their production limit.
mapText: The owner of this card applies +1 to the result of their fighters' combat rolls. The owner of this card may produce 1 additional fighter for their cost; these additional units do not count against their production limit.

name: Public Execution ω
text1: The elected player discards half of their action cards, rounded up. If they have the speaker token, they give it to the player on their right. They cannot vote or resolve abilities during this agenda phase.

name: Publicize Weapon Schematics ω
text1: Each player who owns a unit upgrade technology of the same type as the elected unit places 2 command tokens from their reinforcements in their strategy pool. Then, each player gains a unit upgrade technology of the same type as the elected unit.

name: Regulated Conscription ω
text1: For: When a player produces units, they produce only 1 fighter and infantry for its cost instead of 2.
text2: Against: At the start of the next strategy phase, each player exhausts 1 planet in each system that contains a combined total of 4 or more of their fighters and infantry.
mapText: When a player produces units, they produce only 1 fighter and infantry for its cost instead of 2.

name: Shared Research ω
text1: For: When a player's ships move, they may ignore the effect of any anomaly if it does not contain a frontier token.
text2: Against: Each player who has ships in an anomaly may research 1 technology. Then, each player destroys all of their ships in anomalies that do not contain their space docks.
mapText: Players may ignore the effects of anomalies that do not contain a frontier token during their tactical actions.

name: Unconventional Measures ω
text1: For: Each player returns 1 command token from their command sheet to their reinforcements and draws 4 action cards.
text2: Against: Each player may discard 2 action cards to gain 1 command token; they may repeat this effect any number of times.

name: Wormhole Reconstruction ω
text1: For: All systems that contain a non-delta wormhole are adjacent to each other.
text2: Against: Each player places 1 command token from their reinforcements in each system that contains a non-delta wormhole and their ships. Then, each player may place 1 structure on a planet they control in a system that contains a non-delta wormhole.
mapText: All systems that contain a non-delta wormhole are adjacent to each other.

name: Wormhole Research ω
text1: For: The speaker rolls 1 die. If the result is 6-10, each player may research 1 blue technology. If the result is 1-5, each player destroys 3 of their ships in each system that contains a non-delta wormhole; they must choose non-fighter ships, if able.
text2: Against: Each player draws 1 action card for each system that contains a wormhole and their units.

name: Articles of War ω
text1: For: All mechs lose their printed abilities except for Sustain Damage.
text2: Against: Each player removes 4 of their infantry from the game board.
mapText: All mechs lose their printed abilities except for Sustain Damage.

name: Checks and Balances ω
text1: For: The order that players choose strategy cards during the strategy phase is instead from the player with the fewest victory points to the player with the most; on a tie, the order for those players starts with the speaker and proceeds clockwise.
text2: Against: During the next strategy phase, when a player chooses a strategy card, they give that strategy card to another player who does not have 1.
mapText: Players choose strategy cards during the strategy phase from fewest to most victory points; on a tie, start with the speaker and proceed clockwise.

name: Clandestine Operations ω
text1: For: The player who cast the most votes "For" gains the speaker token; the speaker breaks ties. Then, each other player returns 1 command token from their command sheet to their reinforcements.
text2: Against: Each player destroys 1 of their space docks in a non-home system, if able; otherwise, that player must destroy 2 of their non-fighter ships.

name: Minister of Antiquities ω
text1: The elected player gains this card. After the owner of this card resolves the primary or secondary ability of the "Imperial" strategy card, they look at the top 3 cards of the relic deck and place each card on top of the deck in any order. When the owner of this card ends their turn, they may discard this card to gain 1 relic.
mapText: After the owner of this card resolves the primary or secondary ability of the "Imperial" strategy card, they look at the top 3 cards of the relic deck and place each card on top of the deck in any order. When they end their turn, they may discard this card to gain 1 relic.

name: Nexus Sovereignty ω
text1: For: Alpha and beta wormholes in the wormhole nexus have no effect during movement. The player who controls Mallice may allow a player to ignore this law.
text2: Against: Place a gamma wormhole token in the Mecatol Rex system.
mapText: Alpha and beta wormholes in the wormhole nexus have no effect during movement. The player who controls Mallice may allow a player to ignore this law.

name: Rearmament Agreement ω
text1: For: Each player with the fewest victory points places 1 infantry from their reinforcements on each planet they control.
text2: Against: Each player who cast votes "Against" or abstained must give 1 promissory note from their hand to a player who cast votes "For".

name: Representative Government ω
text1: For: Players cannot exhaust planets to cast votes during the agenda phase; each player may cast 1 vote on each agenda instead. Players cannot cast additional votes.
text2: Against: At the start of the next strategy phase, each player that voted "Against" or abstained exhausts all of their cultural planets.
mapText: Players cannot exhaust planets to cast votes during the agenda phase. each player may cast 1 vote on each agenda instead. Players cannot cast additional votes.

name: Research Grant Reallocation ω
text1: The elected player researches 1 technology; they may ignore 1 prerequisite for each command token from their strategy pool they return to their reinforcements.
